info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 22 at 8:29AM MST until February 22 at 8:45AM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 AM MST FOR NORTHWESTERN MESA...SOUTHWESTERN GARFIELD AND SOUTHERN RIO BLANCO COUNTIES... At 827 AM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 34 miles northwest of Palisade to near Fruita to 13 miles southwest of Grand Junction, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Flash freeze on roads. Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 12 and 43. U.S. Highway 50 in Colorado between mile markers 32 and 44. Colorado 139 between mile markers 1 and 30. Colorado 141 between mile markers 121 and 162. Locations impacted include... Grand Junction, Fruita, Palisade, Loma, Fruitvale, Clifton, Orchard Mesa, Whitewater, Glade Park and Redlands. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Wet roadways will quickly freeze. Black ice will cause roads, bridges, and overpasses to become slick and dangerous. Slow down and be prepared for a sudden loss of traction. Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED
